data.title: Trade Desk Is Maintained at Outperform by Oppenheimer
data.description: This news item displays a headline only and has no other text.

data.title: Toronto Stocks Rise; Toronto-Dominion Bank Up on Higher 1Q Revenue, Profit
data.description:
By Adriano Marchese

Toronto stocks were higher in midday trading on Thursday, with most sectors showing gains.

Shares of transportation, tech services and producer manufacturing companies led the market higher. Consumer discretionary, tech and health tech stocks were the main decliners.

Canada's S&P/TSX Composite Index rose 0.5% to 34290.61, and the blue-chip S&P/TSX 60 rose 0.4% to 1976.33.

Banks continued to post results with Toronto-Dominion Bank and Royal Bank of Canada reporting earnings.

Toronto-Dominion Bank's stock rose by 0.9% to 134.20 Canadian dollars, equivalent to $98.13, after logging higher first-quarter earnings. Revenue growth across its operations, including higher loan and deposit volumes in Canada, and strength in its wealth-management and markets-facing segments boosted results.

On the broader economic front, Canada's current-account deficit narrowed in the fourth quarter, capping a year in which the shortfall doubled amid trade tensions and commodity-price volatility.

Other market movers:

Royal Bank of Canada's shares slipped 1.8% to C$232.92 after reporting an elevated credit-loss provision, despite seeing growth in its wealth management, personal banking and capital markets operations.

Quebecor shares rose 0.5% to C$55.40 after it reported higher fourth-quarter results. The addition of more mobile users to its network helped boost revenue.

Gildan Activewear missed adjusted earnings per share and profit expectations in the fourth quarter. The company noted that it has found more synergies from its newly-acquired HanesBrands unit. Gildan also said it has put up HanesBrands' Australia unit up for sale. Shares decline 4.6% to C$93.03.

Write to Adriano Marchese at adriano.marchese@wsj.com

data.title: SGMT: Lead FASN inhibitor advances in MASH and acne, with pivotal trials and regulatory milestones ahead
data.description:
Denifanstat shows strong efficacy in MASH and acne, with phase II and III trials meeting key endpoints and demonstrating safety. Combination with resmetirom is advancing, aiming for frontline MASH therapy. Chinese approval for acne is expected within a year, with significant milestone payments anticipated.

Based on

Disclaimer
This is an AI-generated summary and may contain inaccuracies. Please verify any important information with the original source.

data.title: Global Net Lease: $3.4B in asset sales, AFFO beat, and credit upgrades set the stage for disciplined 2026 growth
data.description:
2025 saw a major portfolio transformation, $3.4B in asset sales, and significant deleveraging, with AFFO exceeding guidance and credit upgrades achieved. 2026 guidance focuses on disciplined capital recycling, reducing office exposure, and selective acquisitions.

Based on Global Net Lease Q4 2025 Audio Transcript — Feb. 26 2026

Disclaimer
This is an AI-generated summary and may contain inaccuracies. Please verify any important information with the original source.

data.title: IQV: Strong Q4 growth, robust AI-driven strategy, and stable margins signal continued expansion
data.description:
Q4 delivered strong growth across segments, with Commercial Solutions and R&DS both showing momentum. AI is viewed as a major growth driver, leveraging proprietary data and domain expertise, while only minor consulting areas face risk. Margins and capital strategy remain stable, with optimism for continued expansion.

Based on

This is an AI-generated summary and may contain inaccuracies. Please verify any important information with the original source.

data.title: MCS: Record hotel results and strong theater outperformance drive positive 2026 outlook
data.description:
Fourth quarter and full-year results showed revenue and earnings growth in both divisions, with hotels achieving record performance and theaters outperforming industry benchmarks. Capital expenditures are set to decrease in 2026, supporting higher free cash flow and continued shareholder returns.

Based on

Disclaimer
This is an AI-generated summary and may contain inaccuracies. Please verify any important information with the original source.

data.title: ELPE: Adjusted EBITDA hit EUR 1.1 billion, with robust marketing and power growth, and a higher dividend
data.description:
Adjusted EBITDA reached EUR 1.1 billion, with net income at EUR 0.5 billion and a 20% higher dividend. Strong refining and marketing performance offset refinery turnarounds, while power and renewables expanded. Outlook for 2026 includes lower refinery volumes and continued investment.

Based on

Disclaimer
This is an AI-generated summary and may contain inaccuracies. Please verify any important information with the original source.

data.title: Eurobank Ergasias Services and Holdings: Record 2025 results and ambitious 2028 targets driven by growth, digitalization, and capital returns
data.description:
2025 saw all targets exceeded, with strong loan and deposit growth, record profits, and enhanced shareholder returns. The 2026-2028 plan targets 17% ROTBV, 10% EPS CAGR, and continued digital investment, supported by robust economic conditions and M&A synergies.

Based on Eurobank Ergasias Services and Holdings Q4 2025 Audio Transcript — Feb. 26 2026

data.title: Nvidia Results Show Compute Demand is Nowhere Near Slowing — Market Talk
data.description: Nvidia's latest quarterly results show "insatiable demand for compute," D.A. Davidson analysts say in a note. Demand for compute extends well beyond Nvidia's current Blackwell generation to Hopper and Ampere, which are still highly utilized across hyperscaler and neocloud platforms, the analysts say. "We are simply not seeing demand slowing down for compute for the foreseeable future," they say, as models continue to grow more intelligent each week. (kelly.cloonan@wsj.com)

data.title: Mortgage Rates Are Under 6% for the First Time in Years. Why It Matters for Buyers. — Barrons.com
data.description:
By Shaina Mishkin

Mortgage rates have fallen below 6% for the first time in more than three years, according to one closely watched weekly measure.

The average 30-year fixed rate mortgage was 5.98% this past week, Freddie Mac said Thursday. That's down from 6.01% last week and from 6.76% a year ago.

A rapid rise in mortgage rates from historic pandemic lows and stubbornly high home prices have weighed on home sales for three straight years. Mortgage rates have not been lower than 6% since September 2022, according to historic data.

Daily 30-year fixed rates below 6% were reported earlier this week by Mortgage News Daily, but economists often use the Freddie Mac weekly average as the standard measure of mortgage rates because of its long history tracking rate changes.

This is breaking news. Check back soon for more analysis.

Write to Shaina Mishkin at shaina.mishkin@dowjones.com

This content was created by Barron's, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. Barron's is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

data.title: Zai Lab Ltd reports results for the quarter ended December 31 - Earnings Summary
data.description:
• Zai Lab Ltd reported a quarterly adjusted loss of 5 cents​​ per share for the quarter ended December 31, higher than the same quarter last year, when the company reported EPS of -8 cents. The mean expectation of two analysts for the quarter was for a loss of 6 cents per share. Wall Street expected results to range from -8 cents to -5 cents per share.

  • Revenue rose 17.1% to $127.09 million from a year ago; analysts expected $124.47 million.

  • Zai Lab Ltd's reported EPS for the quarter was a loss of 5 cents​.

  • The company reported a quarterly loss of $50.41 million.

  • Zai Lab Ltd shares had risen by 9.5% this quarter.

FORECAST CHANGES

  • The mean earnings estimate of analysts had fallen by about 44.9% in the last three months.​

  • In the last 30 days, there have been no earnings estimate revisions by analysts covering the company.

RECOMMENDATIONS

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "buy" and the breakdown of recommendations is 6 "strong buy" or "buy," 2 "hold" and no "sell" or "strong sell." The average consensus recommendation for the pharmaceuticals peer group is also "buy"

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for Zai Lab Ltd is HK$22.46, about 35.5% above its last closing price of HK$14.48

This summary was machine generated from LSEG data February 26 at 05:30 p.m. UTC. ​All figures in US dollars unless otherwise stated. (For questions concerning the data in this report, contact Estimates.Support@lseg.com. For any other questions or feedback, contact RefinitivNewsSupport@thomsonreuters.com)

data.title: CNBC to unify digital and TV news operations, cut nearly a dozen jobs, sources say
data.description:
By Dawn Chmielewski and Aditya Soni

CNBC is restructuring its newsroom to unify its TV and digital operations in a move that would result in nearly a dozen layoffs including the departure of the website's managing editor, Jeff McCracken, four sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

The cuts are part of an overhaul under Editor-in-Chief David Cho, as CNBC prepares to introduce a paywall on its website, the sources said, requesting anonymity because the information was not public.

"The changes made today are to align CNBC’s newsroom structure for the future, they are not driven by cost cutting," a CNBC spokesperson said in a statement. "We expect to hire more than 40 new editorial roles over the next year across TV, digital, and direct-to-consumer platforms."

CNBC is among the most-watched cable networks thanks to its live coverage of markets and global business developments.

The layoffs come weeks after Versant Media , the parent company of CNBC, was spun out of Comcast .

Shares of Versant have declined more than 30% since the company listed on the Nasdaq in January.

Besides CNBC, Versant also owns cable networks such as USA, MS NOW, Oxygen, as well as digital assets like Fandango and Rotten Tomatoes.

data.title: REG - Imperial Brands PLC - Transaction in Own Shares
data.description:
RNS Number : 6028U Imperial Brands PLC 26 February 2026  

IMPERIAL BRANDS PLC

Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) No. 549300DFVPOB67JL3A42

Transaction in own shares

Imperial Brands PLC (the "Company") announces that on 26 February 2026 it purchased for cancellation the following number of its ordinary shares of 10 pence each pursuant to its GBP 1.45 billion share repurchase programme, details of which were announced on 30 October 2025.

Description of shares: Imperial Brands PLC - ordinary shares of 10 pence

Number of shares repurchased: 116,904

Date of transaction: 26 February 2026

Average price paid per share: GBp 3,262.19

Lowest price paid per share: GBp 3,241.00

Highest price paid per share: GBp 3,279.00

Broker: Morgan Stanley & Co. International Plc ("Morgan Stanley")

The Company intends to cancel these Shares.

All shares were purchased from Morgan Stanley as an on exchange transaction subject to the rules of the London Stock Exchange.

Following the purchase and subsequent settlement and cancellation of these shares, the remaining number of ordinary shares in issue will be 788,403,853 (excluding treasury shares).

The figure of 788,403,853 may be used by shareholders (and others with notification obligations) as the denominator for the calculations by which they will determine if they are required to notify their interest in, or a change to their interest in, the Company under the Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.

In accordance with Article 5(1)(b) of Regulation (EU) No 596/2014 (the Market Abuse Regulation), detailed information about the individual purchases is attached to this announcement.

http://www.rns-pdf.londonstockexchange.com/rns/6028U_1-2026-2-26.pdf

Contacts:

John Crosse     +44 (0) 7484967842

data.title: Teleperformance 2025 revenue slightly misses estimates
data.description:
Overview

  • Digital business services firm's 2025 revenue slightly missed analyst expectations

  • Company appoints Jorge Amar as CEO, effective March 16, 2026

Outlook

  • Teleperformance expects 2026 revenue growth between 0.0% and 2.0% LFL

  • Company anticipates stable recurring EBITA margin of around 14.6% in 2026

  • Teleperformance plans net free cash flow generation of €800-850 mln in 2026

Result Drivers

  • CORE SERVICES GROWTH - Positive momentum in Data Services for AI, Sales, Customer Care, and Back-office solutions drove Core Services revenue growth by 2.7% LFL

  • AMERICAS RECOVERY - Americas region returned to growth with a 1.4% LFL increase, supported by offshore BPO demand and new contracts in Latin America

  • SPECIALIZED SERVICES CHALLENGE - Revenue in Specialized Services was impacted by the non-renewal of a significant visa application management contract, leading to a 9.3% LFL decline

Company press release:

Key Details

*Applies to a deviation of less than 1%; not applicable for per-share numbers.

Analyst Coverage

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "buy" and the breakdown of recommendations is 11 "strong buy" or "buy", 6 "hold" and 1 "sell" or "strong sell"

  • The average consensus recommendation for the business support services peer group is "buy"

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for Teleperformance SE is €102.50, about 103.6% above its February 25 closing price of €50.34

  • The stock recently traded at 5 times the next 12-month earnings vs. a P/E of 5 three months ago
